intro: Saussurea gracilis f. pseudogracilis, commonly known as the slender saussurea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial characterized by its slender, often branched stems and small, narrow leaves. The plant produces yellow to orange composite flowers, typical of the daisy family, which bloom in late summer. It is native to the alpine regions of Central Asia and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. This subspecies is noted for its delicate appearance and is often found in rocky or meadow habitats.
